channel.title: Geology on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Geology on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: The Calbuco volcano in Chile has erupted; 23 April 2015, early a.m. update
item.description: The pictures coming out of Calbuco are stunning, let me find a few to save them here. Local coverage is from biobiochile.cl: Volcán Calbuco retoma proceso eruptivo con expulsión de material incandescente Una densa columna de lava y material incandescente comenzó a desprenderse desde el cráter del volcán Calbuco pasada la 1:00 de la madrugada de este jueves, en lo que fue calificado como una reactivación abrupta del macizo.

item.title: Is the Northern Michigan Geologic Repository Association a public body under Michigan FOIA
item.description: The question from a story in the Marquette Mining Journal: MARQUETTE - Marquette County Circuit Court Judge Thomas Solka heard oral arguments Thursday on a case involving whether the Northern Michigan Geologic Repository Association is a public body subject to producing financial information under the Freedom of Information Act. The association is important to plaintiffs in the case because it was created under state law requirements by the Michigan Department of Environmental Quality, which makes it a public body by extension, the plaintiffs contend.

item.title: Power outages follow Christchurch, New Zealand earthquake
item.description: Ann Arbor, December 22, 2011 - Three strong earthquakes of more than magnitude 5 hit Christchurch, New Zealand today, disrupting the power and telecommunications networks in the area and damaging roads and structures because of liquefaction of the soil. Damage and injury estimates are incomplete as of this writing. According to USGS, three earthquake hits christchurch today , 5.8 at 01:58:36 PM, 5.3 at 02:06:25 PM and 5.8 at 03:18:02 PM #eqnz

item.description: from Soil Textural Triangle, in Plantfacts, a wiki at Ohio State University.

item.title: Alaska volcano maps - Mt. Redoubt, 2009
item.description: There are active volcanoes in Alaska, especially now including Mt. Redoubt.  It appears likely to erupt as of this writing, and I'm not expecting to be on the top of things when it does.  The Alaska Volcano Observatory is the best source of current information, and they are using twitter at @alaska_avo for updates. Here are some sources for Alaska volcano maps - so you know where things are, how far apart the various places are, and what might be downwind.
